metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Very well," Snape cut in. "We'll have another little chat soon, when you've had time to think things over and decided where your loyalties lie."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He threw his cloak over his head and strode out of the clearing. It was almost dark now, but Harry could see Quirrell, standing quite still as though he was petrified.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Harry, where have you been?" Hermione squeaked.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We won! You won! We won!" shouted Ron, thumping Harry on the back. "And I gave Malfoy a black eye, and Neville tried to take on Crabbe and Goyle single-handed! He's still out cold but Madam Pomftey says he'll be all right - talk about showing Slytherin! Everyone's waiting for you in the common room, we're having a party, Fred and George stole some cakes and stuff from the kitchens."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Never mind that now," said Harry breathlessly. "Let's find an empty room, you wait 'til you hear this...."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He made sure Peeves wasn't inside before shutting the door behind them, then he told them what he'd seen and heard.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "So we were right, it is the Sorcerer's Stone, and Snape's trying to force Quirrell to help him get it. He asked if he knew how to get past

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Fluffy - and he said something about Quirrell's 'hocus pocuss-- I reckon there are other things guarding the stone apart from Fluffy, loads of enchantments, probably, and Quirrell would have done some anti-Dark Arts spell that Snape needs to break through --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "So you mean the Stone's only safe as long as Quirrell stands up to Snape?" said Hermione in alarm.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It'll be gone by next Tuesday," said Ron.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: CHAPTER FOURTEEN

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: NORBERT THE NORWEGIAN RIDGEBACK

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Quirrell, however, must have been braver than they'd thought. In the weeks that followed he did seem to be getting paler and thinner, but it didn't look as though he'd cracked yet.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Every time they passed the third-floor corridor, Harry, Ron, and Hermione would press their ears to the door to check that Fluffy was still growling inside. Snape was sweeping about in his usual bad temper, which surely meant that the Stone was still safe. Whenever Harry passed Quirrell these days he gave him an encouraging sort of smile, and Ron had started telling people off for laughing at Quirrell's stutter.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione, however, had more on her mind than the Sorcerer's Stone. She had started drawing up study schedules and colorcoding all her notes. Harry and Ron wouldn't have minded, but she kept nagging them to do the same.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Hermione, the exams are ages away."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Ten weeks," Hermione snapped. "That's not ages, that's like a second to Nicolas Flamel."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But we're not six hundred years old," Ron reminded her. "Anyway, what are you studying for, you already know it A."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "What am I studying for? Are you crazy? You realize we need to pass these exams to get into the second year? They're very important, I should have started studying a month ago, I don't know what's gotten into me...."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Unfortunately, the teachers seemed to be thinking along the same lines as Hermione. They piled so much homework on them that the Easter holidays weren't nearly as much fun as the Christmas ones. It was hard to relax with Hermione next to you reciting the twelve uses of dragon's blood or practicing wand movements. Moaning and yawning, Harry and Ron spent most of their free time in the library with her, trying to get through all their extra work.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I'll never remember this," Ron burst out one afternoon, throwing down his quill and looking longingly out of the library window. It was the first really fine day they'd had in months. The sky was a clear, forget-me-not blue, and there was a feeling in the air of summer coming.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry, who was looking up "Dittany" in One Thousand Magical Herbs and Fungi, didn't look up until he heard Ron say, "Hagrid! What are you doing in the library?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hagrid shuffled into view, hiding something behind his back. He looked very out of place in his moleskin overcoat.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Jus' lookin'," he said, in a shifty voice that got their interest at once. "An' what're you lot up ter?" He looked suddenly suspicious. "Yer not still lookin' fer Nicolas Flamel, are yeh?" "Oh, we found out who he is ages ago," said Ron impressively. "And we know what that dog's guarding, it's a Sorcerer's St --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Shhhh!" Hagrid looked around quickly to see if anyone was listening. "Don' go shoutin' about it, what's the matter with yeh?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "There are a few things we wanted to ask you, as a matter of fact," said Harry, "about what's guarding the Stone apart from Fluffy --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "SHHHH!" said Hagrid again. "Listen - come an' see me later, I'm not promisin' I'll tell yeh anythin', mind, but don' go rabbitin' about it in here, students aren' s'pposed ter know. They'll think I've told yeh

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "See you later, then," said Harry.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hagrid shuffled off.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "What was he hiding behind his back?" said Hermione thoughtfully.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Do you think it had anything to do with the Stone?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I'm going to see what section he was in," said Ron, who'd had enough of working. He came back a minute later with a pile of books in his arms and slammed them down on the table.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Dragons!" he whispered. "Hagrid was looking up stuff about dragons! Look at these: Dragon Species of Great Britain and Ireland; From Egg to Inferno, A Dragon Keeper's Guide."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Hagrid's always wanted a dragon, he told me so the first time I ever met him, " said Harry.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But it's against our laws," said Ron. "Dragon breeding was outlawed by the Warlocks' Convention of 1709, everyone knows that. It's hard to stop Muggles from noticing us if we're keeping dragons in the back garden - anyway, you can't tame dragons, it's dangerous. You should see the burns Charlie's got off wild ones in Romania."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But there aren't wild dragons in Britain?" said Harry.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Of course there are," said Ron. "Common Welsh Green and Hebridean Blacks. The Ministry of Magic has a job hushing them up, I can tell you. Our kind have to keep putting spells on Muggles who've spotted them, to make them forget."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "So what on earths Hagrid up to?" said Hermione.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: When they knocked on the door of the gamekeeper's hut an hour later, they were surprised to see that all the curtains were closed. Hagrid called "Who is it?" before he let them in, and then shut the door quickly behind them.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It was stifling hot inside. Even though it was such a warm day, there was a blazing fire in the grate. Hagrid made them tea and offered them stoat sandwiches, which they refused.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "So -- yeh wanted to ask me somethin'?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yes," said Harry. There was no point beating around the bush. "We were wondering if you could tell us what's guarding the Sorcerer's Stone apart from Fluffy."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hagrid frowned at him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "0' course I cant, he said. "Number one, I don' know meself. Number two, yeh know too much already, so I wouldn' tell yeh if I could. That Stone's here fer a good reason. It Was almost stolen outta Gringotts - I s'ppose yeh've worked that out an' all? Beats me how yeh even know abou' Fluffy."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Oh, come on, Hagrid, you might not want to tell us, but you do know, you know everything that goes on round here," said Hermione in a warm, flattering voice. Hagrid's beard twitched and they could tell he was smiling. "We only wondered who had done the guarding, really." Hermione went on. "We wondered who Dumbledore had trusted enough to help him, apart from you."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hagrid's chest swelled at these last words. Harry and Ron beamed at Hermione.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well, I don' s'pose it could hurt ter tell yeh that... let's see... he borrowed Fluffy from me... then some o' the teachers did enchantments... Professor Sprout -- Professor Flitwick -- Professor McGonagall --" he ticked them off on his fingers, "Professor Quirrell -- an' Dumbledore himself did somethin', o' course. Hang on, I've forgotten someone. Oh yeah, Professor Snape."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Snape?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yeah -- yer not still on abou' that, are yeh? Look, Snape helped protect the Stone, he's not about ter steal it."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry knew Ron and Hermione were thinking the same as he was. If Snape had been in on protecting the Stone, it must have been easy to find out how the other teachers had guarded it. He probably knew everything -- except, it seemed, Quirrell's spell and how to get past Fluffy.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You're the only one who knows how to get past Fluffy. aren't you, Hagrid?" said Harry anxiously. "And you wouldn't tell anyone, would you? Not even one of the teachers?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Not a soul knows except me an' Dumbledore," said Hagrid proudly.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well, that's something," Harry muttered to the others. "Hagrid, can we

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: have a window open? I'm boiling."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Can't, Harry, sorry," said Hagrid. Harry noticed him glance at the fire. Harry looked at it, too.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Hagrid -- what's that?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: But he already knew what it was. In the very heart of the fire, underneath the kettle, was a huge, black egg.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Ah," said Hagrid, fiddling nervously with his beard, "That's er..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Where did you get it, Hagrid?" said Ron, crouching over the fire to get a closer look at the egg. "It must've cost you a fortune."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Won it," said Hagrid. "Las' night. I was down in the village havin' a few drinks an' got into a game o' cards with a stranger. Think he was quite glad ter get rid of it, ter be honest."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But what are you going to do with it when it's hatched?" said Hermione.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well, I've bin doin' some readin' , said Hagrid, pulling a large book from under his pillow. "Got this outta the library -- Dragon Breeding for Pleasure and Profit -- it's a bit outta date, o' course, but it's all in here. Keep the egg in the fire, 'cause their mothers breathe on I em, see, an' when it hatches, feed it on a bucket o' brandy mixed with chicken blood every half hour. An' see here -- how ter recognize diff'rent eggs -- what I got there's a Norwegian Ridgeback. They're rare, them."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He looked very pleased with himself, but Hermione didn't.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Hagrid, you live in a wooden house," she said.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: But Hagrid wasn't listening. He was humming merrily as he stoked the fire.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: So now they had something else to worry about: what might happen to Hagrid if anyone found out he was hiding an illegal dragon in his hut. "Wonder what it's like to have a peaceful life," Ron sighed, as evening after evening they struggled through all the extra homework they were getting. Hermione had now started making study schedules for Harry and Ron, too. It was driving them nuts.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Then, one breakfast time, Hedwig brought Harry another note from Hagrid. He had written only two words: It's hatching.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Ron wanted to skip Herbology and go straight down to the hut. Hermione wouldn't hear of it.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Hermione, how many times in our lives are we going to see a dragon hatching?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We've got lessons, we'll get into trouble, and that's nothing to what Hagrid's going to be in when someone finds out what he's doing --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Shut up!" Harry whispered.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Malfoy was only a few feet away and he had stopped dead to listen. How much had he heard? Harry didn't like the look on Malfoy's face at all.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Ron and Hermione argued all the way to Herbology and in the end, Hermione agreed to run down to Hagrid's with the other two during morning break. When the bell sounded from the castle at the end of their lesson, the three of them dropped their trowels at once and hurried through the grounds to the edge of the forest. Hagrid greeted them, looking flushed and excited.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It's nearly out." He ushered them inside.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The egg was lying on the table. There were deep cracks in it. Something was moving inside; a funny clicking noise was coming from it.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They all drew their chairs up to the table and watched with bated breath.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: All at once there was a scraping noise and the egg split open. The baby dragon flopped onto the table. It wasn't exactly pretty; Harry thought it looked like a crumpled, black umbrella. Its spiny wings were huge compared to its skinny jet body, it had a long snout with wide nostrils, the stubs of horns and bulging, orange eyes.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It sneezed. A couple of sparks flew out of its snout.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Isn't he beautiful?" Hagrid murmured. He reached out a hand to stroke the dragon's head. It snapped at his fingers, showing pointed fangs.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Bless him, look, he knows his mommy!" said Hagrid.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Hagrid," said Hermione, "how fast do Norwegian Ridgebacks grow, exactly?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hagrid was about to answer when the color suddenly drained from his face -- he leapt to his feet and ran to the window.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "What's the matter?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Someone was lookin' through the gap in the curtains -- it's a kid -- he's runnin' back up ter the school."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry bolted to the door and looked out. Even at a distance there was no mistaking him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Malfoy had seen the dragon.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Something about the smile lurking on Malfoy's face during the next week made Harry, Ron, and Hermione very nervous. They spent most of their free time in Hagrid's darkened hut, trying to reason with him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Just let him go," Harry urged. "Set him free."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I can't," said Hagrid. "He's too little. He'd die."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They looked at the dragon. It had grown three times in length in just a week. Smoke kept furling out of its nostrils. Hagrid hadn't been doing his gamekeeping duties because the dragon was keeping him so busy. There were empty brandy bottles and chicken feathers all over the floor.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I've decided to call him Norbert," said Hagrid, looking at the dragon with misty eyes. "He really knows me now, watch. Norbert! Norbert! Where's Mommy?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "He's lost his marbles," Ron muttered in Harry's ear.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Hagrid," said Harry loudly, "give it two weeks and Norbert's going to be as long as your house. Malfoy could go to Dumbledore at any moment."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hagrid bit his lip.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I -- I know I can't keep him forever, but I can't jus' dump him, I can't."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry suddenly turned to Ron. Charlie, he said.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You're losing it, too," said Ron. "I'm Ron, remember?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "No -- Charlie -- your brother, Charlie. In Romania. Studying dragons. We could send Norbert to him. Charlie can take care of him and then put him back in the wild!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Brilliant!" said Ron. "How about it, Hagrid?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: And in the end, Hagrid agreed that they could send -an owl to Charlie to ask him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The following week dragged by. Wednesday night found Hermione and Harry sitting alone in the common room, long after everyone else had gone to bed. The clock on the wall had just

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: chimed midnight when the portrait hole burst open. Ron appeared out of nowhere as he pulled off Harry's invisibility cloak. He had been down at Hagrid's hut, helping him feed Norbert, who was now eating dead rats by the crate.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It bit me!" he said, showing them his hand, which was wrapped in a bloody handkerchief. "I'm not going to be able to hold a quill for a week. I tell you, that dragon's the most horrible animal I've ever met, but the way Hagrid goes on about it, you'd think it was a fluffy little bunny rabbit. When it bit me he told me off for frightening it. And when I left, he was singing it a lullaby."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: There was a tap on the dark window.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It's Hedwig!" said Harry, hurrying to let her in. "She'll have Charlie's answer!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The three of them put their heads together to read the note.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Dear Ron,

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: How are you? Thanks for the letter -- I'd be glad to take the Norwegian Ridgeback, but it won't be easy getting him here. I think the best thing

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: will be to send him over with some friends of mine who are coming to visit me next week. Trouble is, they mustn't be seen carrying an illegal dragon.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Could you get the Ridgeback up the tallest tower at midnight on Saturday? They can meet you there and take him away while it's still dark.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Send me an answer as soon as possible.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Love,

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Charlie

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They looked at one another.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We've got the invisibility cloak," said Harry. "It shouldn't be too difficult -- I think the cloaks big enough to cover two of us and Norbert."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It was a mark of how bad the last week had been that the other two agreed with him. Anything to get rid of Norbert -- and Malfoy.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: There was a hitch. By the next morning, Ron's bitten hand had swollen to twice its usual size. He didn't know whether it was safe to go to Madam Pomfrey -- would she recognize a dragon bite? By the afternoon, though, he had no choice. The cut had turned a nasty shade of green. It looked as if Norbert's fangs were poisonous.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry and Hermione rushed up to the hospital wing at the end of the day to find Ron in a terrible state in bed.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It's not just my hand," he whispered, "although that feels like it's about to fall off. Malfoy told Madam Pomfrey he wanted to borrow one of my books so he could come and have a good laugh at me. He kept threatening to tell her what really bit me -- I've told her it was a dog, but I don't think she believes me -I shouldn't have hit him at the Quidditch match, that's why he's doing this."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry and Hermione tried to calm Ron down.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It'll all be over at midnight on Saturday," said Hermione, but this didn't soothe Ron at all. On the contrary, he sat bolt upright and broke

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: into a sweat.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Midnight on Saturday!" he said in a hoarse voice. "Oh no oh no -- I've just remembered -- Charlie's letter was in that book Malfoy took, he's going to know we're getting rid of Norbert."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry and Hermione didn't get a chance to answer. Madam Pomfrey came over at that moment and made them leave, saying Ron needed sleep.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It's too late to change the plan now," Harry told Hermione. "We haven't got time to send Charlie another owl, and this could be our only chance to get rid of Norbert. We'll have to risk it. And we have got the invisibility cloak, Malfoy doesn't know about that."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They found Fang, the boarhound, sitting outside with a bandaged tail when they went to tell Hagrid, who opened a window to talk to them.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I won't let you in," he puffed. "Norbert's at a tricky stage -- nothin' I can't handle."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: When they told him about Charlie's letter, his eyes filled with tears, although that might have been because Norbert had just bitten him on the leg.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Aargh! It's all right, he only got my boot -- jus' playin' -- he's only a baby, after all."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The baby banged its tail on the wall, making the windows rattle. Harry and Hermione walked back to the castle feeling Saturday couldn't come quickly enough.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They would have felt sorry for Hagrid when the time came for him to say good-bye to Norbert if they hadn't been so worried about what they had to do. It was a very dark, cloudy night, and they were a bit late arriving at Hagrid's hut because they'd had to wait for Peeves to get out of their way in the entrance hall, where he'd been playing tennis against the wall. Hagrid had Norbert packed and ready in a large crate.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "He's got lots o' rats an' some brandy fer the journey," said Hagrid in a muffled voice. "An' I've packed his teddy bear in case he gets lonely."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: From inside the crate came ripping noises that sounded to Harry as

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: though the teddy was having his head torn off.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Bye-bye, Norbert!" Hagrid sobbed, as Harry and Hermione covered the crate with the invisibility cloak and stepped underneath it themselves. "Mommy will never forget you!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: How they managed to get the crate back up to the castle, they never knew. Midnight ticked nearer as they heaved Norbert up the marble staircase in the entrance hall and along the dark corridors. UP another staircase, then another -- even one of Harry's shortcuts didn't make the work much easier.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Nearly there!" Harry panted as they reached the corridor beneath the tallest tower.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Then a sudden movement ahead of them made them almost drop the crate. Forgetting that they were already invisible, they shrank into the shadows, staring at the dark outlines of two people grappling with each other ten feet away. A lamp flared.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Professor McGonagall, in a tartan bathrobe and a hair net, had Malfoy by the ear.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Detention!" she shouted. "And twenty points from Slytherin! Wandering around in the middle of the night, how dare you --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You don't understand, Professor. Harry Potter's coming -- he's got a dragon!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "What utter rubbish! How dare you tell such lies! Come on -- I shall see Professor Snape about you, Malfoy!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The steep spiral staircase up to the top of the tower seemed the easiest thing in the world after that. Not until they'd stepped out into the cold night air did they throw off the cloak, glad to be able to breathe properly again. Hermione did a sort of jig.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Malfoy's got detention! I could sing!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Don't," Harry advised her.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Chuckling about Malfoy, they waited, Norbert thrashing about in his crate. About ten minutes later, four broomsticks came swooping down out

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: of the darkness.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Charlie's friends were a cheery lot. They showed Harry and Hermione the harness they'd rigged up, so they could suspend Norbert between them. They all helped buckle Norbert safely into it and then Harry and Hermione shook hands with the others and thanked them very much.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: At last, Norbert was going... going... gone.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They slipped back down the spiral staircase, their hearts as light as their hands, now that Norbert was off them. No more dragon -- Malfoy in detention -- what could spoil their happiness?

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The answer to that was waiting at the foot of the stairs. As they stepped into the corridor, Filch's face loomed suddenly out of the darkness.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well, well, well," he whispered, "we are in trouble."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They'd left the invisibility cloak on top of the tower.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: CHAPTER FIFTEEN

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: THE FORIBIDDEN FOREST

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Things couldn't have been worse.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Filch took them down to Professor McGonagall's study on the first floor, where they sat and waited without saying a word to each other. Hermione was trembling. Excuses, alibis, and wild cover- up stories chased each other around Harry's brain, each more feeble than the last. He couldn't see how they were going to get out of trouble this time. They were cornered. How could they have been so stupid as to forget the cloak? There was no reason on earth that Professor McGonagall would accept for their being out of bed and creeping around the school in the dead of night, let alone being up the tallest astronomy tower, which was out-of-bounds except for classes. Add Norbert and the invisibility cloak, and they might as well be packing their bags already.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Had Harry thought that things couldn't have been worse? He was wrong. When Professor McGonagall appeared, she was leading Neville.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Harry!" Neville burst Out, the moment he saw the other two. "I was trying to find you to warn you, I heard Malfoy saying he was going to catch you, he said you had a drag --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry shook his head violently to shut Neville up, but Professor McGonagall had seen. She looked more likely to breathe fire than Norbert as she towered over the three of them.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I would never have believed it of any of you. Mr. Filch says you were up in the astronomy tower. It's one o'clock in the morning. Explain yourselves."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It was the first time Hermione had ever failed to answer a teacher's question. She was staring at her slippers, as still as a statue.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I think I've got a good idea of what's been going on," said Professor McGonagall. "It doesn't take a genius to work it out. You fed Draco Malfoy some cock-and-bull story about a dragon, trying to get him out of bed and into trouble. I've already caught him. I suppose you think it's funny that Longbottom here heard the story and believed it, too?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry caught Neville's eye and tried to tell him without words that this wasn't true, because Neville was looking stunned and hurt. Poor, blundering Neville -- Harry knew what it must have cost him to try and find them in the dark, to warn them.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I'm disgusted," said Professor McGonagall. "Four students out of bed in one night! I've never heard of such a thing before! You, Miss Granger, I thought you had more sense. As for you, Mr. Potter, I thought Gryffindor meant more to you than this. All three of you will receive detentions -- yes, you too, Mr. Longbottom, nothing gives you the right to walk around school at night, especially these days, it's very dangerous -- and fifty points will be taken from Gryffindor."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Fifty?" Harry gasped -- they would lose the lead, the lead he'd won in the last Quidditch match.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Fifty points each," said Professor McGonagall, breathing heavily through her long, pointed nose.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Professor -- please

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You can't --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Don't tell me what I can and can't do, Potter. Now get back to bed, all of you. I've never been more ashamed of Gryffindor students."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: A hundred and fifty points lost. That put Gryffindor in last place. In one night, they'd ruined any chance Gryffindor had had for the house cup. Harry felt as though the bottom had dropped out of his stomach. How could they ever make up for this?

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry didn't sleep all night. He could hear Neville sobbing into his pillow for what seemed like hours. Harry couldn't think of anything to say to comfort him. He knew Neville, like himself, was dreading the dawn. What would happen when the rest of Gryffindor found out what they'd done?

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: At first, Gryffindors passing the giant hourglasses that recorded the house points the next day thought there'd been a mistake. How could they suddenly have a hundred and fifty points fewer than yesterday? And then the story started to spread: Harry Potter, the famous Harry Potter, their hero of two Quidditch matches, had lo st them all those points, him and a couple of other stupid first years.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: From being one of the most popular and admired people at the school, Harry was suddenly the most hated. Even Ravenclaws and Hufflepuffs turned on him, because everyone had been longing to see Slytherin lose the house cup. Everywhere Harry went, people pointed and didn't trouble to lower their voices as they insulted him. Slytherins, on the other hand, clapped as he walked past them, whistling and cheering, "Thanks Potter, we owe you one!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Only Ron stood by him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "They'll all forget this in a few weeks. Fred and George have lost loads of points in all the time they've been here, and people still like them."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "They've never lost a hundred and fifty points in one go, though, have they?" said Harry miserably.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well -- no," Ron admitted.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It was a bit late to repair the damage, but Harry swore to himself not to meddle in things that weren't his business from now on. He'd had it

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: with sneaking around and spying. He felt so ashamed of himself that he went to Wood and offered to resign from the Quidditch team.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Resign?" Wood thundered. "What good'll that do? How are we going to get any points back if we can't win at Quidditch?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: But even Quidditch had lost its fun. The rest of the team wouldn't speak to Harry during practice, and if they had to speak about him, they called him "the Seeker."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione and Neville were suffering, too. They didn't have as bad a time as Harry, because they weren't as well-known, but nobody would speak to them, either. Hermione had stopped drawing attention to herself in class, keeping her head down and working in silence.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry was almost glad that the exams weren't far away. All the studying he had to do kept his mind off his misery. He, Ron, and Hermione kept to themselves, working late into the night, trying to remember the ingredients in complicated potions, learn charms and spells by heart, memorize the dates of magical discoveries and goblin rebellions....

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Then, about a week before the exams were due to start, Harry's new resolution not to interfere in anything that didn't concern him was put to an unexpected test. Walking back from the library on his own one afternoon, he heard somebody whimpering from a classroom up ahead. As he drew closer, he heard Quirrell's voice.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "No -- no -- not again, please --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It sounded as though someone was threatening him. Harry moved closer.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "All right -- all right --" he heard Quirrell sob.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Next second, Quirrell came hurrying out of the classroom straightening his turban. He was pale and looked as though he was about to cry. He strode out of sight; Harry didn't think Quirrell had even noticed him. He waited until Quirrell's footsteps had disappeared, then peered into the classroom. It was empty, but a door stood ajar at the other end. Harry was halfway toward it before he remembered what he'd promised himself about not meddling.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: All the same, he'd have gambled twelve Sorcerer's Stones that Snape had just left the room, and from what Harry had just heard, Snape would be

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: walking with a new spring in his step -- Quirrell seemed to have given in at last.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry went back to the library, where Hermione was testing Ron on Astronomy. Harry told them what he'd heard.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Snape's done it, then!" said Ron. "If Quirrell's told him how to break his Anti-Dark Force spell --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "There's still Fluffy, though," said Hermione.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Maybe Snape's found out how to get past him without asking Hagrid," said Ron, looking up at the thousands of books surrounding them. "I bet there's a book somewhere in here telling you how to get past a giant three-headed dog. So what do we do, Harry?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The light of adventure was kindling again in Ron's eyes, but Hermione answered before Harry could.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Go to Dumbledore. That's what we should have done ages ago. If we try anything ourselves we'll be thrown out for sure."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But we've got no proof!" said Harry. "Quirrell's too scared to back us up. Snape's only got to say he doesn't know how the troll got in at Halloween and that he was nowhere near the third floor -- who do you think they'll believe, him or us? It's not exactly a secret we hate him, Dumbledore'll think we made it up to get him sacked. Filch wouldn't help us if his life depended on it, he's too friendly with Snape, and the more students get thrown out, the better, he'll think. And don't forget, we're not supposed to know about the Stone or Fluffy. That'll take a lot of explaining."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione looked convinced, but Ron didn't.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "If we just do a bit of poking around --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "No," said Harry flatly, "we've done enough poking around."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He pulled a map of Jupiter toward him and started to learn the names of its moons.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The following morning, notes were delivered to Harry, Hermione, and Neville at the breakfast table. They were all the same:

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Your detention will take place at eleven o'clock tonight. Meet Mr. Filch in the entrance hall.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Professor McGonagall Harry had forgotten they still had detentions to do in the furor over the points they'd lost. He half expected Hermione to complain that this was a whole night of studying lost, but she didn't say a word. Like Harry, she felt they deserved what they'd got.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: At eleven o'clock that night, they said good-bye to Ron in the common room and went down to the entrance hall with Neville. Filch was already there -- and so was Malfoy. Harry had also forgotten that Malfoy had gotten a detention, too.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Follow me," said Filch, lighting a lamp and leading them outside.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: I bet you'll think twice about breaking a school rule again, won't you, eh?" he said, leering at them. "Oh yes... hard work and pain are the best teachers if you ask me.... It's just a pity they let the old punishments die out... hang you by your wrists from the ceiling for a few days, I've got the chains still in my office, keep 'em well oiled in case they're ever needed.... Right, off we go, and don't think of running off, now, it'll be worse for you if you do."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They marched off across the dark grounds. Neville kept sniffing. Harry wondered what their punishment was going to be. It must be something really horrible, or Filch wouldn't be sounding so delighted.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The moon was bright, but clouds scudding across it kept throwing them into darkness. Ahead, Harry could see the lighted windows of Hagrid's hut. Then they heard a distant shout.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Is that you, Filch? Hurry up, I want ter get started."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry's heart rose; if they were going to be working with Hagrid it wouldn't be so bad. His relief must have showed in his -face, because Filch said, "I suppose you think you'll be enjoying yourself with that oaf? Well, think again, boy -- it's into the forest you're going and I'm much mistaken if you'll all come out in one piece."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: At this, Neville let out a little moan, and Malfoy stopped dead in his tracks.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "The forest?" he repeated, and he didn't sound quite as cool as usual. "We can't go in there at night -- there's all sorts of things in there -- werewolves, I heard."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Neville clutched the sleeve of Harry's robe and made a choking noise.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "That's your problem, isn't it?" said Filch, his voice cracking with glee. "Should've thought of them werewolves before you got in trouble, shouldn't you?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hagrid came striding toward them out of the dark, Fang at his heel. He was carrying his large crossbow, and a quiver of arrows hung over his shoulder.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Abou' time," he said. "I bin waitin' fer half an hour already. All right, Harry, Hermione?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I shouldn't be too friendly to them, Hagrid," said Filch coldly, they're here to be punished, after all."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "That's why yer late, is it?" said Hagrid, frowning at Filch. "Bin lecturin' them, eh? 'Snot your place ter do that. Yeh've done yer bit, I'll take over from here."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I'll be back at dawn," said Filch, "for what's left of them," he added nastily, and he turned and started back toward the castle, his lamp bobbing away in the darkness.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Malfoy now turned to Hagrid.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I'm not going in that forest, he said, and Harry was pleased to hear the note of panic in his voice.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yeh are if yeh want ter stay at Hogwarts," said Hagrid fiercely. "Yeh've done wrong an' now yehve got ter pay fer it."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But this is servant stuff, it's not for students to do. I thought we'd be copying lines or something, if my father knew I was doing this, he'd

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: tell yer that's how it is at Hogwarts," Hagrid growled. "Copyin' lines! What good's that ter anyone? Yeh'll do summat useful or Yeh'll get out. If yeh think yer father'd rather you were expelled, then get back off ter the castle an' pack. Go on"'

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Malfoy didn't move. He looked at Hagrid furiously, but then dropped his gaze.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Right then," said Hagrid, "now, listen carefully, 'cause it's dangerous what we're gonna do tonight, an' I don' want no one takin' risks. Follow me over here a moment."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He led them to the very edge of the forest. Holding his lamp up high, he pointed down a narrow, winding earth track that disappeared into the thick black trees. A light breeze lifted their hair as they looked into the forest.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Look there," said Hagrid, "see that stuff shinin' on the ground? Silvery stuff? That's unicorn blood. There's a unicorn in there bin hurt badly by summat. This is the second time in a week. I found one dead last Wednesday. We're gonna try an' find the poor thing. We might have ter put it out of its misery."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "And what if whatever hurt the unicorn finds us first?" said Malfoy, unable to keep the fear out of his voice.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "There's nothin' that lives in the forest that'll hurt yeh if yer with me or Fang," said Hagrid. "An' keep ter the path. Right, now, we're gonna split inter two parties an' follow the trail in diff'rent directions. There's blood all over the place, it must've bin staggerin' around since last night at least."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I want Fang," said Malfoy quickly, looking at Fang's long teeth.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "All right, but I warn yeh, he's a coward," said Hagrid. " So me, Harry, an' Hermione'll go one way an' Draco, Neville, an' Fang'll go the other. Now, if any of us finds the unicorn, we'll send up green sparks, right? Get yer wands out an' practice now -- that's it -- an' if anyone gets in trouble, send up red sparks, an' we'll all come an' find yeh -- so, be careful -- let's go."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The forest was black and silent. A little way into it they reached a fork in the earth path, and Harry, Hermione, and Hagrid took the left path while Malfoy, Neville, and Fang took the right.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They walked in silence, their eyes on the ground. Every now and then a ray of moonlight through the branches above lit a spot of silver-blue

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: blood on the fallen leaves.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry saw that Hagrid looked very worried.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Could a werewolf be killing the unicorns?" Harry asked.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Not fast enough," said Hagrid. "It's not easy ter catch a unicorn, they're powerful magic creatures. I never knew one ter be hurt before."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They walked past a mossy tree stump. Harry could hear running water; there must be a stream somewhere close by. There were still spots of unicorn blood here and there along the winding path.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You all right, Hermione?" Hagrid whispered. "Don' worry, it can't've gone far if it's this badly hurt, an' then we'll be able ter -- GET BEHIND THAT TREE!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hagrid seized Harry and Hermione and hoisted them off the path behind a towering oak. He pulled out an arrow and fitted it into his crossbow, raising it, ready to fire. The three of them listened. Something was slithering over dead leaves nearby: it sounded like a cloak trailing along the ground. Hagrid was squinting up the dark path, but after a few seconds, the sound faded away.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I knew it, " he murmured. "There's summat in here that shouldn' be."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "A werewolf?" Harry suggested.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "That wasn' no werewolf an' it wasn' no unicorn, neither," said Hagrid grimly. "Right, follow me, but careful, now."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They walked more slowly, ears straining for the faintest sound. Suddenly, in a clearing ahead, something definitely moved.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Who's there?" Hagrid called. "Show yerself -- I'm armed!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: And into the clearing came -- was it a man, or a horse? To the waist, a man, with red hair and beard, but below that was a horse's gleaming chestnut body with a long, reddish tail. Harry and Hermione's jaws dropped.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Oh, it's you, Ronan," said Hagrid in relief. "How are yeh?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He walked forward and shook the centaur's hand.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Good evening to you, Hagrid," said Ronan. He had a deep, sorrowful voice. "Were you going to shoot me?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Can't be too careful, Ronan," said Hagrid, patting his crossbow. "There's summat bad loose in this forest. This is Harry Potter an' Hermione Granger, by the way. Students up at the school. An' this is Ronan, you two. He's a centaur.))

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We'd noticed," said Hermione faintly.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Good evening," said Ronan. "Students, are you? And do you learn much, up at the school?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Erm --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "A bit," said Hermione timidly.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "A bit. Well, that's something." Ronan sighed. He flung back his head and stared at the sky. "Mars is bright tonight."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yeah," said Hagrid, glancing up, too. "Listen, I'm glad we've run inter yeh, Ronan, 'cause there's a unicorn bin hurt -- you seen anythin'?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Ronan didn't answer immediately. He stared unblinkingly upward, then sighed again.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Always the innocent are the first victims," he said. "So it has been for ages past, so it is now."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yeah," said Hagrid, "but have yeh seen anythin', Ronan? Anythin' unusual?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Mars is bright tonight," Ronan repeated, while Hagrid watched him impatiently. "Unusually bright."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yeah, but I was meanin' anythin' unusual a bit nearer home, said Hagrid. "So yeh haven't noticed anythin' strange?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Yet again, Ronan took a while to answer. At last, he said, "The forest hides many secrets."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: A movement in the trees behind Ronan made Hagrid raise his bow again, but it was only a second centaur, black-haired and -bodied and wilder-looking than Ronan.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Hullo, Bane," said Hagrid. "All right?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Good evening, Hagrid, I hope you are well?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well enough. Look, I've jus' bin askin' Ronan, you seen anythin' odd in here lately? There's a unicorn bin injured -- would yeh know anythin' about it?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Bane walked over to stand next to Ronan. He looked skyward. "Mars is bright tonight," he said simply.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We've heard," said Hagrid grumpily. "Well, if either of you do see anythin', let me know, won't yeh? We'll be off, then."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry and Hermione followed him out of the clearing, staring over their shoulders at Ronan and Bane until the trees blocked their view.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Never," said Hagrid irritably, "try an' get a straight answer out of a centaur. Ruddy stargazers. Not interested in anythin' closer'n the moon."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Are there many of them in here?" asked Hermione.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Oh, a fair few... Keep themselves to themselves mostly, but they're good enough about turnin' up if ever I want a word. They're deep, mind, centaurs... they know things... jus' don' let on much."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "D'you think that was a centaur we heard earlier?" said Harry.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Did that sound like hooves to you? Nah, if yeh ask me, that was what's bin killin' the unicorns -- never heard anythin' like it before."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They walked on through the dense, dark trees. Harry kept looking nervously over his shoulder. He had the nasty feeling they were being watched. He was very glad they had Hagrid and his crossbow with them. They had just passed a bend in the path when Hermione grabbed Hagrid's arm.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Hagrid! Look! Red sparks, the others are in trouble!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You two wait here!" Hagrid shouted. "Stay on the path, I'll come back for yeh!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They heard him crashing away through the undergrowth and stood looking at each other, very scared, until they couldn't hear anything but the rustling of leaves around them.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You don't think they've been hurt, do you?" whispered Hermione.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I don't care if Malfoy has, but if something's got Neville... it's our fault he's here in the first place."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The minutes dragged by. Their ears seemed sharper than usual. Harry's seemed to be picking up every sigh of the wind, every cracking twig. What was going on? Where were the others?

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: At last, a great crunching noise announced Hagrid's return. Malfoy, Neville, and Fang were with him. Hagrid was fuming. Malfoy, it seemed, had sneaked up behind Neville and grabbed him as a joke. Neville had panicked and sent up the sparks.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We'll be lucky ter catch anythin' now, with the racket you two were makin'. Right, we're changin' groups -- Neville, you stay with me an' Hermione, Harry, you go with Fang an' this idiot. I'm sorry," Hagrid added in a whisper to Harry, "but he'll have a harder time frightenin' you, an' we've gotta get this done."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: So Harry set off into the heart of the forest with Malfoy and Fang. They walked for nearly half an hour, deeper and deeper into the forest, until the path became almost impossible to follow because the trees were so thick. Harry thought the blood seemed to be getting thicker. There were splashes on the roots of a tree, as though the poor creature had been thrashing around in pain close by. Harry could see a clearing ahead, through the tangled branches of an ancient oak.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Look --" he murmured, holding out his arm to stop Malfoy.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Something bright white was gleaming on the ground. They inched closer.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It was the unicorn all right, and it was dead. Harry had never seen anything so beautiful and sad. Its long, slender legs were stuck out at odd angles where it had fallen and its mane was spread pearly-white on

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: the dark leaves.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry had taken one step toward it when a slithering sound made him freeze where he stood. A bush on the edge of the clearing quivered.... Then, out of the shadows, a hooded figure came crawling across the ground like some stalking beast. Harry, Malfoy, and Fang stood transfixed. The cloaked figure reached the unicorn, lowered its head over the wound in the animal's side, and began to drink its blood.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "AAAAAAAAAARGH!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Malfoy let out a terrible scream and bolted -- so did Fang. The hooded figure raised its head and looked right at Harry -- unicorn blood was dribbling down its front. It got to its feet and came swiftly toward Harry -- he couldn't move for fear.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Then a pain like he'd never felt before pierced his head; it was as though his scar were on fire. Half blinded, he staggered backward. He heard hooves behind him, galloping, and something jumped clean over Harry, charging at the figure.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The pain in Harry's head was so bad he fell to his knees. It took a minute or two to pass. When he looked up, the figure had gone. A centaur was standing over him, not Ronan or Bane; this one looked younger; he had white-blond hair and a palomino body.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Are you all right?" said the centaur, pulling Harry to his feet.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yes -- thank you -- what was that?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The centaur didn't answer. He had astonishingly blue eyes, like pale sapphires. He looked carefully at Harry, his eyes lingering on the scar that stood out, livid, on Harry's forehead.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You are the Potter boy," he said. "You had better get back to Hagrid. The forest is not safe at this time -- especially for you. Can you ride? It will be quicker this way.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "My name is Firenze," he added, as he lowered himself on to his front legs so that Harry could clamber onto his back.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: There was suddenly a sound of more galloping from the other side of the clearing. Ronan and Bane came bursting through the trees, their flanks

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: heaving and sweaty.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Firenze!" Bane thundered. "What are you doing? You have a human on your back! Have you no shame? Are you a common mule?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Do you realize who this is?" said Firenze. "This is the Potter boy. The quicker he leaves this forest, the better."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "What have you been telling him?" growled Bane. "Remember, Firenze, we are sworn not to set ourselves against the heavens. Have we not read what is to come in the movements of the planets?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Ronan pawed the ground nervously. "I'm sure Firenze thought he was acting for the best, " he said in his gloomy voice.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Bane kicked his back legs in anger.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "For the best! What is that to do with us? Centaurs are concerned with what has been foretold! It is not our business to run around like donkeys after stray humans in our forest!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Firenze suddenly reared on to his hind legs in anger, so that Harry had to grab his shoulders to stay on.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Do you not see that unicorn?" Firenze bellowed at Bane. "Do you not understand why it was killed? Or have the planets not let you in on that secret? I set myself against what is lurking in this forest, Bane, yes, with humans alongside me if I must."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: And Firenze whisked around; with Harry clutching on as best he could, they plunged off into the trees, leaving Ronan and Bane behind them.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry didn't have a clue what was going on.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Why's Bane so angry?" he asked. "What was that thing you saved me from, anyway?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Firenze slowed to a walk, warned Harry to keep his head bowed in case of low-hanging branches, but did not answer Harry's question. They made their way through the trees in silence for so long that Harry thought Firenze didn't want to talk to him anymore. They were passing through a particularly dense patch of trees, however, when Firenze suddenly stopped.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Harry Potter, do you know what unicorn blood is used -for?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "No," said Harry, startled by the odd question. "We've only used the horn and tail hair in Potions."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "That is because it is a monstrous thing, to slay a unicorn," said Firenze. "Only one who has nothing to lose, and everything to gain, would commit such a crime. The blood of a unicorn will keep you alive, even if you are an inch from death, but at a terrible price. You have slain something pure and defenseless to save yourself, and you will have but a half-life, a cursed life, from the moment the blood touches your lips."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry stared at the back of Firenze's head, which was dappled silver in the moonlight.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But who'd be that desperate?" he wondered aloud. "If you're going to be cursed forever, deaths better, isn't it?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It is," Firenze agreed, "unless all you need is to stay alive long enough to drink something else -- something that will bring you back to full strength and power -- something that will mean you can never die. Mr. Potter, do you know what is hidden in the school at this very moment?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "The Sorcerer's Stone! Of course -- the Elixir of Life! But I don't understand who --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Can you think of nobody who has waited many years to return to power, who has clung to life, awaiting their chance?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It was as though an iron fist had clenched suddenly around Harry's heart. Over the rustling of the trees, he seemed to hear once more what Hagrid had told him on the night they had met: "Some say he died. Codswallop, in my opinion. Dunno if he had enough human left in him to die."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Do you mean," Harry croaked, "that was Vol-"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Harry! Harry, are you all right?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione was running toward them down the path, Hagrid puffing along

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: behind her.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I'm fine," said Harry, hardly knowing what he was saying. "The unicorn's dead, Hagrid, it's in that clearing back there."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "This is where I leave you," Firenze murmured as Hagrid hurried off to examine the unicorn. "You are safe now."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry slid off his back.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Good luck, Harry Potter," said Firenze. "The planets have been read wrongly before now, even by centaurs. I hope this is one of those times."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He turned and cantered back into the depths of the forest, leaving Harry shivering behind him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Ron had fallen asleep in the dark common room, waiting for them to return. He shouted something about Quidditch fouls when Harry roughly shook him awake. In a matter of seconds, though, he was wide-eyed as Harry began to tell him and Hermione what had happened in the forest.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry couldn't sit down. He paced up and down in front of the fire. He was still shaking.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Snape wants the stone for Voldemort... and Voldemort's waiting in the forest... and all this time we thought Snape just wanted to get rich...."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Stop saying the name!" said Ron in a terrified whisper, as if he thought Voldemort could hear them.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry wasn't listening.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Firenze saved me, but he shouldn't have done so.... Bane was furious... he was talking about interfering with what the planets say is going to happen.... They must show that Voldemort's coming back.... Bane thinks Firenze should have let Voldemort kill me.... I suppose that's written in the stars as well."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Will you stop saying the name!" Ron hissed.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "So all I've got to wait for now is Snape to steal the Stone," Harry

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: went on feverishly, "then Voldemort will be able to come and finish me off... Well, I suppose Bane'll be happy."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione looked very frightened, but she had a word of comfort.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Harry, everyone says Dumbledore's the only one You-Know-Who was ever afraid of With Dumbledore around, You-Know-Who won't touch you. Anyway, who says the centaurs are right? It sounds like fortune-telling to me, and Professor McGonagall says that's a very imprecise branch of magic."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The sky had turned light before they stopped talking. They went to bed exhausted, their throats sore. But the night's surprises weren't over.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: When Harry pulled back his sheets, he found his invisibility cloak folded neatly underneath them. There was a note pinned to it:

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Just in case.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: CHAPTER SIXTEEN

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: THROUGH THE TRAPDOOR

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: In years to come, Harry would never quite remember how he had managed to get through his exams when he half expected Voldemort to come bursting through the door at any moment. Yet the days crept by, and there could be no doubt that Fluffy was still alive and well behind the locked door.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It was sweltering hot, especially in the large classroom where they did their written papers. They had been given special, new quills for the exams, which had been bewitched with an AntiCheating spell.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They had practical exams as well. Professor Flitwick called them one by one into his class to see if they could make a pineapple tapdance across a desk. Professor McGonagall watched them turn a mouse into a snuffbox -- points were given for how pretty the snuffbox was, but taken away if it had whiskers. Snape made them all nervous, breathing down their necks while they tried to remember how to make a Forgetfulness potion.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry did the best he could, trying to ignore the stabbing pains in his forehead, which had been bothering him ever since his trip into the forest. Neville thought Harry had a bad case of exam nerves because Harry couldn't sleep, but the truth was that Harry kept being woken by

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: his old nightmare, except that it was now worse than ever because there was a hooded figure dripping blood in it.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Maybe it was because they hadn't seen what Harry had seen in the forest, or because they didn't have scars burning on their foreheads, but Ron and Hermione didn't seem as worried about the Stone as Harry. The idea of Voldemort certainly scared them, but he didn't keep visiting them in dreams, and they were so busy with their studying they didn't have much time to fret about what Snape or anyone else might be up to.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Their very last exam was History of Magic. One hour of answering questions about batty old wizards who'd invented selfstirring cauldrons and they'd be free, free for a whole wonderful week until their exam results came out. When the ghost of Professor Binns told them to put down their quills and roll up their parchment, Harry couldn't help cheering with the rest.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "That was far easier than I thought it would be," said Hermione as they joined the crowds flocking out onto the sunny grounds. "I needn't have learned about the 1637 Werewolf Code of Conduct or the uprising of Elfric the Eager."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione always liked to go through their exam papers afterward, but Ron said this made him feel ill, so they wandered down to the lake and flopped under a tree. The Weasley twins and Lee Jordan were tickling the tentacles of a giant squid, which was basking in the warm shallows. "No more studying," Ron sighed happily, stretching out on the grass. "You could look more cheerful, Harry, we've got a week before we find out how badly we've done, there's no need to worry yet."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry was rubbing his forehead.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I wish I knew what this means!" he burst out angrily. "My scar keeps hurting -- it's happened before, but never as often as this."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Go to Madam Pomfrey," Hermione suggested.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I'm not ill," said Harry. "I think it's a warning... it means danger's coming...."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Ron couldn't get worked up, it was too hot.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Harry, relax, Hermione's right, the Stone's safe as long as

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Dumbledore's around. Anyway, we've never had any proof Snape found out how to get past Fluffy. He nearly had his leg ripped off once, he's not going to try it again in a hurry. And Neville will play Quidditch for England before Hagrid lets Dumbledore down."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry nodded, but he couldn't shake off a lurking feeling that there was something he'd forgotten to do, something important. When he tried to explain this, Hermione said, "That's just the exams. I woke up last night and was halfway through my Transfiguration notes before I remembered we'd done that one."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry was quite sure the unsettled feeling didn't have anything to do with work, though. He watched an owl flutter toward the school across the bright blue sky, a note clamped in its mouth.
