Hagrid was the only one who ever sent him letters. Hagrid would never betray Dumbledore. Hagrid would never tell anyone how to get past Fluffy... never... but --

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry suddenly jumped to his feet.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Where're you going?" said Ron sleepily.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I've just thought of something," said Harry. He had turned white. "We've got to go and see Hagrid, now."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Why?" panted Hermione, hurrying to keep up.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Don't you think it's a bit odd," said Harry, scrambling up the grassy slope, "that what Hagrid wants more than anything else is a dragon, and a stranger turns up who just happens to have an egg in his pocket? How many people wander around with dragon eggs if it's against wizard law? Lucky they found Hagrid, don't you think? Why didn't I see it before?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "What are you talking about?" said Ron, but Harry, sprinting across the grounds toward the forest, didn't answer.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hagrid was sitting in an armchair outside his house; his trousers and sleeves were rolled up, and he was shelling peas into a large bowl.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Hullo," he said, smiling. "Finished yer exams? Got time fer a drink?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yes, please," said Ron, but Harry cut him off.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "No, we're in a hurry. Hagrid, I've got to ask you something. You know

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: that night you won Norbert? What did the stranger you were playing cards with look like?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Dunno," said Hagrid casually, "he wouldn' take his cloak off."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He saw the three of them look stunned and raised his eyebrows.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It's not that unusual, yeh get a lot o' funny folk in the Hog's Head -- that's the pub down in the village. Mighta bin a dragon dealer, mightn' he? I never saw his face, he kept his hood up."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry sank down next to the bowl of peas. "What did you talk to him about, Hagrid? Did you mention Hogwarts at all?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Mighta come up," said Hagrid, frowning as he tried to remember. "Yeah... he asked what I did, an' I told him I was gamekeeper here.... He asked a bit about the sorta creatures I took after... so I told him... an' I said what I'd always really wanted was a dragon... an' then... I can' remember too well, 'cause he kept buyin' me drinks.... Let's see... yeah, then he said he had the dragon egg an' we could play cards fer it if I wanted... but he had ter be sure I could handle it, he didn' want it ter go ter any old home.... So I told him, after Fluffy, a dragon would be easy..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "And did he -- did he seem interested in Fluffy?" Harry asked, try ing to keep his voice calm.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well -- yeah -- how many three-headed dogs d'yeh meet, even around Hogwarts? So I told him, Fluffy's a piece o' cake if yeh know how to calm him down, jus' play him a bit o' music an' he'll go straight off ter sleep --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hagrid suddenly looked horrified.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I shouldn'ta told yeh that!" he blurted out. "Forget I said it! Hey -- where're yeh goin'?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry, Ron, and Hermione didn't speak to each other at all until they came to a halt in the entrance hall, which seemed very cold and gloomy after the grounds.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We've got to go to Dumbledore," said Harry. "Hagrid told that stranger how to get past Fluffy, and it was either Snape or Voldemort under that

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: cloak -- it must've been easy, once he'd got Hagrid drunk. I just hope Dumbledore believes us. Firenze might back us up if Bane doesn't stop him. Where's Dumbledore's office?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They looked around, as if hoping to see a sign pointing them in the right direction. They had never been told where Dumbledore lived, nor did they know anyone who had been sent to see him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We'll just have to --" Harry began, but a voice suddenly rang across the hall.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "What are you three doing inside?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It was Professor McGonagall, carrying a large pile of books.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We want to see Professor Dumbledore," said Hermione, rather bravely, Harry and Ron thought.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "See Professor Dumbledore?" Professor McGonagall repeated, as though this was a very fishy thing to want to do. "Why?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry swallowed -- now what?

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It's sort of secret," he said, but he wished at once he hadn't, because Professor McGonagall's nostrils flared.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Professor Dumbledore left ten minutes ago," she said coldly. "He received an urgent owl from the Ministry of Magic and flew off for London at once."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "He's gone?" said Harry frantically. "Now?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Professor Dumbledore is a very great wizard, Potter, he has many demands on his time --

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But this is important."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Something you have to say is more important than the Ministry of Magic, Potter.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Look," said Harry, throwing caution to the winds, "Professor -- it's about the Sorcerer's tone --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Whatever Professor McGonagall had expected, it wasn't that. The books she was carrying tumbled out of her arms, but she didn't pick them up. "How do you know --?" she spluttered.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Professor, I think -- I know -- that Sn- that someone's going to try and steal the Stone. I've got to talk to Professor Dumbledore."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: She eyed him with a mixture of shock and suspicion.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Professor Dumbledore will be back tomorrow," she said finally. I don't know how you found out about the Stone, but rest assured, no one can possibly steal it, it's too well protected."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But Professor --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Potter, I know what I'm talking about," she said shortly. She bent down and gathered up the fallen books. I suggest you all go back outside and enjoy the sunshine."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: But they didn't.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It's tonight," said Harry, once he was sure Professor McGonagall was out of earshot. "Snape's going through the trapdoor tonight. He's found out everything he needs, and now he's got Dumbledore out of the way. He sent that note, I bet the Ministry of Magic will get a real shock when Dumbledore turns up."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But what can we --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione gasped. Harry and Ron wheeled round.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Snape was standing there.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Good afternoon," he said smoothly.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They stared at him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You shouldn't be inside on a day like this," he said, with an odd, twisted smile.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We were --" Harry began, without any idea what he was going to say.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You want to be more careful," said Snape. "Hanging around

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: like this, people will think you're up to something. And Gryffindor really can't afford to lose any more points, can it?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry flushed. They turned to go outside, but Snape called them back.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Be warned, Potter -- any more nighttime wanderings and I will personally make sure you are expelled. Good day to you."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He strode off in the direction of the staffroom.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Out on the stone steps, Harry turned to the others.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Right, here's what we've got to do," he whispered urgently. "One of us has got to keep an eye on Snape -- wait outside the staff room and follow him if he leaves it. Hermione, you'd better do that."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Why me?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It's obvious," said Ron. "You can pretend to be waiting for Professor Flitwick, you know." He put on a high voice, "'Oh Professor Flitwick, I'm so worried, I think I got question fourteen b wrong....'"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Oh, shut up," said Hermione, but she agreed to go and watch out for Snape.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "And we'd better stay outside the third-floor corridor," Harry told Ron. "Come on."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: But that part of the plan didn't work. No sooner had they reached the door separating Fluffy from the rest of the school than Professor McGonagall turned up again and this time, she lost her temper.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I suppose you think you're harder to get past than a pack of enchantments!" she stormed. "Enough of this nonsense! If I hear you 've come anywhere near here again, I'll take another fifty points from Gryffindor! Yes, Weasley, from my own house!" Harry and Ron went back to the common room, Harry had just said, "At least Hermione's on Snape's tail," when the portrait of the Fat Lady swung open and Hermione came in.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I'm sorry, Harry!" she wailed. "Snape came out and asked me what I was doing, so I said I was waiting for Flitwick, and Snape went to get him,

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: and I've only just got away, I don't know where Snape went."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well, that's it then, isn't it?" Harry said.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The other two stared at him. He was pale and his eyes were glittering.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I'm going out of here tonight and I'm going to try and get to the Stone first."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You're mad!" said Ron.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You can't!" said Hermione. "After what McGonagall and Snape have said? You'll be expelled!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "SO WHAP" Harry shouted. "Don't you understand? If Snape gets hold of the Stone, Voldemort's coming back! Haven't you heard what it was like when he was trying to take over? There won't be any Hogwarts to get expelled from! He'll flatten it, or turn it into a school for the Dark Arts! Losing points doesn't matter anymore, can't you see? D'you think he'll leave you and your families alone if Gryffindor wins the house cup? If I get caught before I can get to the Stone, well, I'll have to go back to the Dursleys and wait for Voldemort to find me there, it's only dying a bit later than I would have, because I'm never going over to the Dark Side! I'm going through that trapdoor tonight and nothing you two say is going to stop me! Voldemort killed my parents, remember?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He glared at them.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You're right Harry," said Hermione in a small voice.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I'll use the invisibility cloak," said Harry. "It's just lucky I got it back."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But will it cover all three of us?" said Ron.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "All -- all three of us?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Oh, come off it, you don't think we'd let you go alone?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Of course not," said Hermione briskly. "How do you think you'd get to the Stone without us? I'd better go and took through my books, there might be something useful..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But if we get caught, you two will be expelled, too."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Not if I can help it," said Hermione grimly. "Flitwick told me in secret that I got a hundred and twelve percent on his exam. They're not throwing me out after that."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: After dinner the three of them sat nervously apart in the common room. Nobody bothered them; none of the Gryffindors had anything to say to Harry any more, after all. This was the first night he hadn't been upset by it. Hermione was skimming through all her notes, hoping to come across one of the enchantments they were about to try to break. Harry and Ron didn't talk much. Both of them were thinking about what they were about to do.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Slowly, the room emptied as people drifted off to bed.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Better get the cloak," Ron muttered, as Lee Jordan finally left, stretching and yawning. Harry ran upstairs to their dark dormitory. He putted out the cloak and then his eyes fell on the flute Hagrid had given him for Christmas. He pocketed it to use on Fluffy -- he didn't feel much like singing.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He ran back down to the common room.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We'd better put the cloak on here, and make sure it covers all three of us -- if Filch spots one of our feet wandering along on its own --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "What are you doing?" said a voice from the corner of the room. Neville appeared from behind an armchair, clutching Trevor the toad, who looked as though he'd been making another bid for freedom.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Nothing, Neville, nothing," said Harry, hurriedly putting the cloak behind his back.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Neville stared at their guilty faces.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You're going out again," he said.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "No, no, no," said Hermione. "No, we're not. Why don't you go to bed, Neville?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry looked at the grandfather clock by the door. They couldn't afford to waste any more time, Snape might even now be playing Fluffy to sleep.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You can't go out," said Neville, "you'll be caught again. Gryffindor will be in even more trouble."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You don't understand," said Harry, "this is important."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: But Neville was clearly steeling himself to do something desperate.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: I won't let you do it," he said, hurrying to stand in front of the portrait hole. "I'll -- I'll fight you!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Neville, "Ron exploded, "get away from that hole and don't be an idiot --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Don't you call me an idiot!" said Neville. I don't think you should be breaking any more rules! And you were the one who told me to stand up to people!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yes, but not to us," said Ron in exasperation. "Neville, you don't know what you're doing."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He took a step forward and Neville dropped Trevor the toad, who leapt out of sight.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Go on then, try and hit me!" said Neville, raising his fists. "I'm ready!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry turned to Hermione.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Do something," he said desperately.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione stepped forward.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Neville," she said, "I'm really, really sorry about this."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: She raised her wand.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Petrificus Totalus!" she cried, pointing it at Neville.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Neville's arms snapped to his sides. His legs sprang together. His whole body rigid, he swayed where he stood and then fell flat on his face, stiff as a board.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione ran to turn him over. Neville's jaws were jammed together so he couldn't speak. Only his eyes were moving, looking at them in horror.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "What've you done to him?" Harry whispered.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It's the full Body-Bind," said Hermione miserably. "Oh, Neville, I'm so sorry."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We had to, Neville, no time to explain," said Harry.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You'll understand later, Neville," said Ron as they stepped over him and pulled on the invisibility cloak.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: But leaving Neville lying motionless on the floor didn't feel like a very good omen. In their nervous state, every statue's shadow looked like Filch, every distant breath of wind sounded like Peeves swooping down on them. At the foot of the first set of stairs, they spotted Mrs. Norris skulking near the top.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Oh, let's kick her, just this once," Ron whispered in Harry's ear, but Harry shook his head. As they climbed carefully around her, Mrs. Norris turned her lamplike eyes on them, but didn't do anything.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They didn't meet anyone else until they reached the staircase up to the third floor. Peeves was bobbing halfway up, loosening the carpet so that people would trip.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Who's there?" he said suddenly as they climbed toward him. He narrowed his wicked black eyes. "Know you're there, even if I can't see you. Are you ghoulie or ghostie or wee student beastie?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He rose up in the air and floated there, squinting at them.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Should call Filch, I should, if something's a-creeping around unseen."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry had a sudden idea.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Peeves," he said, in a hoarse whisper, "the Bloody Baron has his own reasons for being invisible."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Peeves almost fell out of the air in shock. He caught himself in time and hovered about a foot off the stairs.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "So sorry, your bloodiness, Mr. Baron, Sir," he said greasily. "My mistake, my mistake -- I didn't see you -- of course I didn't, you're invisible -- forgive old Peevsie his little joke, sir."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I have business here, Peeves," croaked Harry. "Stay away from this place tonight."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I will, sir, I most certainly will," said Peeves, rising up in the air again. "Hope your business goes well, Baron, I'll not bother you."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: And he scooted off

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Brilliant, Harry!" whispered Ron.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: A few seconds later, they were there, outside the third-floor corridor -- and the door was already ajar.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well, there you are," Harry said quietly, "Snape's already got past Fluffy."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Seeing the open door somehow seemed to impress upon all three of them what was facing them. Underneath the cloak, Harry turned to the other two.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "If you want to go back, I won't blame you," he said. "You can take the cloak, I won't need it now."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Don't be stupid," said Ron.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We're coming," said Hermione.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry pushed the door open.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: As the door creaked, low, rumbling growls met their ears. All three of the dog's noses sniffed madly in their direction, even though it couldn't see them.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "What's that at its feet?" Hermione whispered.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Looks like a harp," said Ron. "Snape must have left it there."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It must wake up the moment you stop playing," said Harry. "Well, here goes..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He put Hagrid's flute to his lips and blew. It wasn't really a tune, but from the first note the beast's eyes began to droop. Harry hardly drew breath. Slowly, the dog's growls ceased -- it tottered on its paws and fell to its knees, then it slumped to the ground, fast asleep.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Keep playing," Ron warned Harry as they slipped out of the cloak and crept toward the trapdoor. They could feel the dog's hot, smelly breath as they approached the giant heads. "I think we'll be able to pull the door open," said Ron, peering over the dog's back. "Want to go first, Hermione?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "No, I don't!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "All right." Ron gritted his teeth and stepped carefully over the dog's legs. He bent and pulled the ring of the trapdoor, which swung up and open.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "What can you see?" Hermione said anxiously.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Nothing -- just black -- there's no way of climbing down, we'll just have to drop."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry, who was still playing the flute, waved at Ron to get his attention and pointed at himself.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You want to go first? Are you sure?" said Ron. "I don't know how deep this thing goes. Give the flute to Hermione so she can keep him asleep."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry handed the flute over. In the few seconds' silence, the dog growled and twitched, but the moment Hermione began to play, it fell back into its deep sleep.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry climbed over it and looked down through the trapdoor. There was no sign of the bottom.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He lowered himself through the hole until he was hanging on by his fingertips. Then he looked up at Ron and said, "If anything happens to me, don't follow. Go straight to the owlery and send Hedwig to Dumbledore, right?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Right," said Ron.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "See you in a minute, I hope...

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: And Harry let go. Cold, damp air rushed past him as he fell down, down, down and -- FLUMP. With a funny, muffled sort of thump he landed on something soft. He sat up and felt around, his eyes not used to the gloom. It felt as though he was sitting on some sort of plant.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It's okay!" he called up to the light the size of a postage stamp, which was the open trapdoor, "it's a soft landing, you can jump!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Ron followed right away. He landed, sprawled next to Harry.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "What's this stuff?" were his first words.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Dunno, some sort of plant thing. I suppose it's here to break the fall. Come on, Hermione!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The distant music stopped. There was a loud bark from the dog, but Hermione had already jumped. She landed on Harry's other side.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We must be miles under the school , she said.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Lucky this plant thing's here, really," said Ron.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Lucky!" shrieked Hermione. "Look at you both!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: She leapt up and struggled toward a damp wall. She had to struggle because the moment she had landed, the plant had started to twist snakelike tendrils around her ankles. As for Harry and Ron, their legs had already been bound tightly in long creepers without their noticing.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione had managed to free herself before the plant got a firm grip on her. Now she watched in horror as the two boys fought to pull the plant off them, but the more they strained against it, the tighter and faster the plant wound around them.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Stop moving!" Hermione ordered them. "I know what this is -- it's Devil's Snare!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Oh, I'm so glad we know what it's called, that's a great help," snarled Ron, leaning back, trying to stop the plant from curling around his neck. "Shut up, I'm trying to remember how to kill it!" said Hermione.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well, hurry up, I can't breathe!" Harry gasped, wrestling with it as it curled around his chest.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Devil's Snare, Devil's Snare... what did Professor Sprout say? -- it likes the dark and the damp

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "So light a fire!" Harry choked.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yes -- of course -- but there's no wood!" Hermione cried, wringing her hands.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "HAVE YOU GONE MAD?" Ron bellowed. "ARE YOU A WITCH OR NOT?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Oh, right!" said Hermione, and she whipped out her wand, waved it, muttered something, and sent a jet of the same bluebell flames she had used on Snape at the plant. In a matter of seconds, the two boys felt it loosening its grip as it cringed away from the light and warmth. Wriggling and flailing, it unraveled itself from their bodies, and they were able to pull free.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Lucky you pay attention in Herbology, Hermione," said Harry as he joined her by the wall, wiping sweat off his face.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yeah," said Ron, "and lucky Harry doesn't lose his head in a crisis -- 'there's no wood,' honestly."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "This way," said Harry, pointing down a stone passageway, which was the only way forward.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: All they could hear apart from their footsteps was the gentle drip of water trickling down the walls. The passageway sloped downward, and Harry was reminded of Gringotts. With an unpleasant jolt of the heart, he remembered the dragons said to be guarding vaults in the wizards' bank. If they met a dragon, a fully-grown dragon -- Norbert had been bad enough...

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Can you hear something?" Ron whispered.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry listened. A soft rustling and clinking seemed to be coming from up ahead.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Do you think it's a ghost?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I don't know... sounds like wings to me."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "There's light ahead -- I can see something moving."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They reached the end of the passageway and saw before them a brilliantly lit chamber, its ceiling arching high above them. It was full of small, jewel-bright birds, fluttering and tumbling all around the room. On the opposite side of the chamber was a heavy wooden door.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Do you think they'll attack us if we cross the room?" said Ron.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Probably," said Harry. "They don't look very vicious, but I suppose if they all swooped down at once... well, there's no other choice... I'll run."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He took a deep breath, covered his face with his arms, and sprinted across the room. He expected to feel sharp beaks and claws tearing at him any second, but nothing happened. He reached the door untouched. He pulled the handle, but it was locked.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The other two followed him. They tugged and heaved at the door, but it wouldn't budge, not even when Hermione tried her Alohomora charm.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Now what?" said Ron.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "These birds... they can't be here just for decoration," said Hermione.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They watched the birds soaring overhead, glittering -- glittering?

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "They're not birds!" Harry said suddenly. "They're keys! Winged keys -- look carefully. So that must mean..." he looked around the chamber while the other two squinted up at the flock of keys. "... yes -- look! Broomsticks! We've got to catch the key to the door!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But there are hundreds of them!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Ron examined the lock on the door.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We're looking for a big, old-fashioned one -- probably silver, like the handle."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They each seized a broomstick and kicked off into the air, soaring into the midst of the cloud of keys. They grabbed and snatched, but the

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: bewitched keys darted and dived so quickly it was almost impossible to catch one.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Not for nothing, though, was Harry the youngest Seeker in a century. He had a knack for spotting things other people didn't. After a minute's weaving about through the whirl of rainbow feathers, he noticed a large silver key that had a bent wing, as if it had already been caught and stuffed roughly into the keyhole.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "That one!" he called to the others. "That big one -- there -- no, there -- with bright blue wings -- the feathers are all crumpled on one side."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Ron went speeding in the direction that Harry was pointing, crashed into the ceiling, and nearly fell off his broom.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We've got to close in on it!" Harry called, not taking his eyes off the key with the damaged wing. "Ron, you come at it from above -- Hermione, stay below and stop it from going down and I'll try and catch it. Right, NOW!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Ron dived, Hermione rocketed upward, the key dodged them both, and Harry streaked after it; it sped toward the wall, Harry leaned forward and with a nasty, crunching noise, pinned it against the stone with one hand. Ron and Hermione's cheers echoed around the high chamber.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They landed quickly, and Harry ran to the door, the key struggling in his hand. He rammed it into the lock and turned -- it worked. The moment the lock had clicked open, the key took flight again, looking very battered now that it had been caught twice.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Ready?" Harry asked the other two, his hand on the door handle. They nodded. He pulled the door open.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The next chamber was so dark they couldn't see anything at all. But as they stepped into it, light suddenly flooded the room to reveal an astonishing sight.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They were standing on the edge of a huge chessboard, behind the black chessmen, which were all taller than they were and carved from what looked like black stone. Facing them, way across the chamber, were the white pieces. Harry, Ron and Hermione shivered slightly -- the towering white chessmen had no faces.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Now what do we do?" Harry whispered.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It's obvious, isn't it?" said Ron. "We've got to play our way across the room."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Behind the white pieces they could see another door.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "How?" said Hermione nervously.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I think," said Ron, "we're going to have to be chessmen."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He walked up to a black knight and put his hand out to touch the knight's horse. At once, the stone sprang to life. The horse pawed the ground and the knight turned his helmeted head to look down at Ron.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Do we -- er -- have to join you to get across?" The black knight nodded. Ron turned to the other two.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "This needs thinking about he said. I suppose we've got to take the place of three of the black pieces...."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry and Hermione stayed quiet, watching Ron think. Finally he said, "Now, don't be offended or anything, but neither of you are that good at chess --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We're not offended," said Harry quickly. "Just tell us what to do."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well, Harry, you take the place of that bishop, and Hermione, YOU 90 next to him instead of that castle."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "What about you?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I'm going to be a knight," said Ron.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The chessmen seemed to have been listening, because at these words a knight, a bishop, and a castle turned their backs on the white pieces and walked off the board, leaving three empty squares that Harry, Ron, and Hermione took.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "White always plays first in chess," said Ron, peering across the board. "Yes... look..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: A white pawn had moved forward two squares.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Ron started to direct the black pieces. They moved silently wherever he sent them. Harry's knees were trembling. What if they lost?

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Harry -- move diagonally four squares to the right."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Their first real shock came when their other knight was taken. The white queen smashed him to the floor and dragged him off the board, where he lay quite still, facedown.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Had to let that happen," said Ron, looking shaken. "Leaves you free to take that bishop, Hermione, go on."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Every time one of their men was lost, the white pieces showed no mercy. Soon there was a huddle of limp black players slumped along the wall. Twice, Ron only just noticed in time that Harry and Hermione were in danger. He himself darted around the board, taking almost as many white pieces as they had lost black ones.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We're nearly there," he muttered suddenly. "Let me think let me think..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The white queen turned her blank face toward him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yes..." said Ron softly, "It's the only way... I've got to be taken."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "NOF Harry and Hermione shouted.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "That's chess!" snapped Ron. "You've got to make some sacrifices! I take one step forward and she'll take me -- that leaves you free to checkmate the king, Harry!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Do you want to stop Snape or not?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Ron --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Look, if you don't hurry up, he'll already have the Stone!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: There was no alternative.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Ready?" Ron called, his face pale but determined. "Here I go - now,

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: don't hang around once you've won."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He stepped forward, and the white queen pounced. She struck Ron hard across the head with her stone arm, and he crashed to the floor - Hermione screamed but stayed on her square - the white queen dragged Ron to one side. He looked as if he'd been knocked out.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Shaking, Harry moved three spaces to the left.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The white king took off his crown and threw it at Harry's feet. They had won. The chessmen parted and bowed, leaving the door ahead clear. With one last desperate look back at Ron, Harry and Hermione charged through the door and up the next passageway.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "What if he's --?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "He'll be all right," said Harry, trying to convince himself. "What do you reckon's next?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We've had Sprout's, that was the Devil's Snare; Flitwick must've put charms on the keys; McGonagall transfigured the chessmen to make them alive; that leaves Quirrell's spell, and Snape's."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They had reached another door.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "All right?" Harry whispered.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Go on."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry pushed it open.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: A disgusting smell filled their nostrils, making both of them pull their robes up over their noses. Eyes watering, they saw, flat on the floor in front of them, a troll even larger than the one they had tackled, out cold with a bloody lump on its head.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I'm glad we didn't have to fight that one," Harry whispered as they stepped carefully over one of its massive legs. "Come on, I can't breathe."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He pulled open the next door, both of them hardly daring to look at what came next - but there was nothing very frightening in here, just a table with seven differently shaped bottles standing on it in a line.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Snape's," said Harry. "What do we have to do?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They stepped over the threshold, and immediately a fire sprang up behind them in the doorway. It wasn't ordinary fire either; it was purple. At the same instant, black flames shot up in the doorway leading onward. They were trapped.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Look!" Hermione seized a roll of paper lying next to the bottles. Harry looked over her shoulder to read it:

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Danger lies before you, while safety lies behind,

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Two of us will help you, which ever you would find,

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: One among us seven will let you move ahead,

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Another will transport the drinker back instead,

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Two among our number hold only nettle wine,

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Three of us are killers, waiting bidden in line.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Choose, unless you wish to stay here forevermore,

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: To help you in your choice, we give you these clues four:

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: First, however slyly the poison tries to hide

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: You will always find some on nettle wine's left side;

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Second, different are those who stand at either end,

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: But if you would move onward, neither is your friend;

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Third, as you see clearly, all are different size,

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Neither dwarf nor giant holds death in their insides;

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Fourth, the second left and the second on the right

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Are twins once you taste them, though different at first sight.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione let out a great sigh and Harry, amazed, saw that she was smiling, the very last thing he felt like doing.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Brilliant," said Hermione. "This isn't magic -- it's logic -- a puzzle. A lot of the greatest wizards haven't got an ounce of logic, they'd be stuck in here forever."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But so will we, won't we?" "Of course not," said Hermione. "Everything we need is here on this paper. Seven bottles: three are poison; two are wine; one will get us safely through the black fire, and one will get us back through the purple."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But how do we know which to drink?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Give me a minute."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione read the paper several times. Then she walked up and down the line of bottles, muttering to herself and pointing at them. At last, she clapped her hands.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Got it," she said. "The smallest bottle will get us through the black fire -- toward the Stone."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry looked at the tiny bottle.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "There's only enough there for one of us," he said. "That's hardly one swallow."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: They looked at each other.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Which one will get you back through the purple flames?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione pointed at a rounded bottle at the right end of the line.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You drink that," said Harry. "No, listen, get back and get Ron. Grab brooms from the flying- key room, they'll get you out of the trapdoor and past Fluffy -- go straight to the owlery and send Hedwig to Dumbledore, we need him. I might be able to hold Snape off for a while, but I'm no match for him, really."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But Harry -- what if You-Know-Who's with him?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well -- I was lucky once, wasn't I?" said Harry, pointing at his scar.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I might get lucky again."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione's lip trembled, and she suddenly dashed at Harry and threw her arms around him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Hermione!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Harry -- you're a great wizard, you know."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I'm not as good as you," said Harry, very embarrassed, as she let go of him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Me!" said Hermione. "Books! And cleverness! There are more important things -- friendship and bravery and -- oh Harry -- be careful!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You drink first," said Harry. "You are sure which is which, aren't you?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Positive," said Hermione. She took a long drink from the round bottle at the end, and shuddered.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It's not poison?" said Harry anxiously.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "No -- but it's like ice."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Quick, go, before it wears off."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Good luck -- take care."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "GO!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione turned and walked straight through the purple fire.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry took a deep breath and picked up the smallest bottle. He turned to face the black flames.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Here I come," he said, and he drained the little bottle in one gulp.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It was indeed as though ice was flooding his body. He put the bottle down and walked forward; he braced himself, saw the black flames licking his body, but couldn't feel them -- for a moment he could see nothing but dark fire -- then he was on the other side, in the last chamber.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: There was already someone there -- but it wasn't Snape. It wasn't even Voldemort.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: CHAPTER SEVENTEEN

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: THE MAN WITH TWO FACES

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It was Quirrell.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You!" gasped Harry.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Quirrell smiled. His face wasn't twitching at all.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Me," he said calmly. "I wondered whether I'd be meeting you here, Potter."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But I thought -- Snape --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Severus?" Quirrell laughed, and it wasn't his usual quivering treble, either, but cold and sharp. "Yes, Severus does seem the type, doesn't he? So useful to have him swooping around like an overgrown bat. Next to him, who would suspect p-p-poor, st-stuttering P-Professor Quirrell?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry couldn't take it in. This couldn't be true, it couldn't.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But Snape tried to kill me!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "No, no, no. I tried to kill you. Your friend Miss Granger accidentally knocked me over as she rushed to set fire to Snape at that Quidditch match. She broke my eye contact with you. Another few seconds and I'd have got you off that broom. I'd have managed it before then if Snape hadn't been muttering a countercurse, trying to save you."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Snape was trying to save me?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Of course," said Quirrell coolly. "\Why do you think he wanted to referee your next match? He was trying to make sure I didn't do it again. Funny, really... he needn't have bothered. I couldn't do anything with Dumbledore watching. All the other teachers thought Snape was trying to stop Gryffindor from winning, he did make himself unpopular... and what a waste of time, when after all that, I'm going to kill you tonight."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Quirrell snapped his fingers. Ropes sprang out of thin air and wrapped themselves tightly around Harry.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You're too nosy to live, Potter. Scurrying around the school on Halloween like that, for all I knew you'd seen me coming to look at what was guarding the Stone."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You let the troll in?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Certainly. I have a special gift with trolls -- you must have seen what I did to the one in the chamber back there? Unfortunately, while everyone else was running around looking for it, Snape, who already suspected me, went straight to the third floor to head me off -- and not only did my troll fail to beat you to death, that three-headed dog didn't even manage to bite Snape's leg off properly.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Now, wait quietly, Potter. I need to examine this interesting mirror.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It was only then that Harry realized what was standing behind Quirrell. It was the Mirror of Erised.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "This mirror is the key to finding the Stone," Quirrell murmured, tapping his way around the frame. "Trust Dumbledore to come up with something like this... but he's in London... I'll be far away by the time he gets back...."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: All Harry could think of doing was to keep Quirrell talking and stop him from concentrating on the mirror.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I saw you and Snape in the forest --" he blurted out.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yes," said Quirrell idly, walking around the mirror to look at the back. "He was on to me by that time, trying to find out how far I'd got. He suspected me all along. Tried to frighten me - as though he could, when I had Lord Voldemort on my side...."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Quirrell came back out from behind the mirror and stared hungrily into it.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I see the Stone... I'm presenting it to my master... but where is it?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry struggled against the ropes binding him, but they didn't give. He

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: had to keep Quirrell from giving his whole attention to the mirror.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But Snape always seemed to hate me so much."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Oh, he does," said Quirrell casually, "heavens, yes. He was at Hogwarts with your father, didn't you know? They loathed each other. But he never wanted you dead."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But I heard you a few days ago, sobbing -- I thought Snape was threatening you...."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: For the first time, a spasm of fear flitted across Quirrell's face.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Sometimes," he said, "I find it hard to follow my master's instructions -- he is a great wizard and I am weak --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You mean he was there in the classroom with you?" Harry gasped.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "He is with me wherever I go," said Quirrell quietly. "I met him when I traveled around the world. A foolish young man I was then, full of ridiculous ideas about good and evil. Lord Voldemort showed me how wrong I was. There is no good and evil, there is only power, and those too weak to seek it.... Since then, I have served him faithfully, although I have let him down many times. He has had to be very hard on me." Quirrell shivered suddenly. "He does not forgive mistakes easily. When I failed to steal the stone from Gringotts, he was most displeased. He punished me... decided he would have to keep a closer watch on me...."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Quirrell's voice trailed away. Harry was remembering his trip to Diagon Alley -how could he have been so stupid? He'd seen Quirrell there that very day, shaken hands with him in the Leaky Cauldron.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Quirrell cursed under his breath.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I don't understand... is the Stone inside the mirror? Should I break it?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry's mind was racing.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: What I want more than anything else in the world at the moment, he thought, is to find the Stone before Quirrell does. So if I look in the mirror, I should see myseff finding it -- which means I'll see where it's hidden! But how can I look without Quirrell realizing what I'm up

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: to?

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He tried to edge to the left, to get in front of the glass without Quirrell noticing, but the ropes around his ankles were too tight: he tripped and fell over. Quirrell ignored him. He was still talking to himself. "What does this mirror do? How does it work? Help me, Master!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: And to Harry's horror, a voice answered, and the voice seemed to come from Quirrell himself

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Use the boy... Use the boy..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Quirrell rounded on Harry.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yes -- Potter -- come here."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He clapped his hands once, and the ropes binding Harry fell off. Harry got slowly to his feet.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Come here," Quirrell repeated. "Look in the mirror and tell me what you see."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry walked toward him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: I must lie, he thought desperately. I must look and lie about what I see, that's all.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Quirrell moved close behind him. Harry breathed in the funny smell that seemed to come from Quirrell's turban. He closed his eyes, stepped in front of the mirror, and opened them again.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He saw his reflection, pale and scared-looking at first. But a moment later, the reflection smiled at him. It put its hand into its pocket and pulled out a blood-red stone. It winked and put the Stone back in its pocket -- and as it did so, Harry felt something heavy drop into his real pocket. Somehow -- incredibly -- he'd gotten the Stone.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well?" said Quirrell impatiently. "What do you see?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry screwed up his courage.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I see myself shaking hands with Dumbledore," he invented. "I -- I've won the house cup for Gryffindor."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Quirrell cursed again.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Get out of the way," he said. As Harry moved aside, he felt the Sorcerer's Stone against his leg. Dare he make a break for it?

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: But he hadn't walked five paces before a high voice spoke, though Quirrell wasn't moving his lips.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "He lies... He lies..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Potter, come back here!" Quirrell shouted. "Tell me the truth! What did you just see?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The high voice spoke again.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Let me speak to him... face-to-face..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Master, you are not strong enough!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I have strength enough... for this...."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry felt as if Devil's Snare was rooting him to the spot. He couldn't move a muscle. Petrified, he watched as Quirrell reached up and began to unwrap his turban. What was going on? The turban fell away. Quirrell's head looked strangely small without it. Then he turned slowly on the spot.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry would have screamed, but he couldn't make a sound. Where there should have been a back to Quirrell's head, there was a face, the most terrible face Harry had ever seen. It was chalk white with glaring red eyes and slits for nostrils, like a snake.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Harry Potter..." it whispered.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry tried to take a step backward but his legs wouldn't move.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "See what I have become?" the face said. "Mere shadow and vapor ... I have form only when I can share another's body... but there have always been those willing to let me into their hearts and minds.... Unicorn blood has strengthened me, these past weeks... you saw faithful Quirrell drinking it for me in the forest... and once I have the Elixir of Life, I will be able to create a body of my own.... Now... why don't you give

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: me that Stone in your pocket?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: So he knew. The feeling suddenly surged back into Harry's legs. He stumbled backward.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Don't be a fool," snarled the face. "Better save your own life and join me... or you'll meet the same end as your parents.... They died begging me for mercy..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "LIAR!" Harry shouted suddenly.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Quirrell was walking backward at him, so that Voldemort could still see him. The evil face was now smiling.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "How touching..." it hissed. "I always value bravery... Yes, boy, your parents were brave.... I killed your father first; and he put up a courageous fight... but your mother needn't have died... she was trying to protect you.... Now give me the Stone, unless you want her to have died in vain."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "NEVER!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry sprang toward the flame door, but Voldemort screamed "SEIZE HIM!" and the next second, Harry felt Quirrell's hand close on his wrist. At once, a needle-sharp pain seared across Harry's scar; his head felt as though it was about to split in two; he yelled, struggling with all his might, and to his surprise, Quirrell let go of him. The pain in his head lessened -- he looked around wildly to see where Quirrell had gone, and saw him hunched in pain, looking at his fingers -- they were blistering before his eyes.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Seize him! SEIZE HIM!" shrieked Voldemort again, and Quirrell lunged, knocking Harry clean off his feet' landing on top of him, both hands around Harry's neck -- Harry's scar was almost blinding him with pain, yet he could see Quirrell howling in agony.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Master, I cannot hold him -- my hands -- my hands!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: And Quirrell, though pinning Harry to the ground with his knees, let go of his neck and stared, bewildered, at his own palms -- Harry could see they looked burned, raw, red, and shiny.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Then kill him, fool, and be done!" screeched Voldemort.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Quirrell raised his hand to perform a deadly curse, but Harry, by instinct, reached up and grabbed Quirrell's face --

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "AAAARGH!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Quirrell rolled off him, his face blistering, too, and then Harry knew: Quirrell couldn't touch his bare skin, not without suffering terrible pain -- his only chance was to keep hold of Quirrell, keep him in enough pain to stop him from doing a curse.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry jumped to his feet, caught Quirrell by the arm, and hung on as tight as he could. Quirrell screamed and tried to throw Harry off -- the pain in Harry's head was building -- he couldn't see -- he could only hear Quirrell's terrible shrieks and Voldemort's yells of, "KILL HIM! KILL HIM!" and other voices, maybe in Harry's own head, crying, "Harry! Harry!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He felt Quirrell's arm wrenched from his grasp, knew all was lost, and fell into blackness, down ... down... down...

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Something gold was glinting just above him. The Snitch! He tried to catch it, but his arms were too heavy.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He blinked. It wasn't the Snitch at all. It was a pair of glasses. How strange.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He blinked again. The smiling face of Albus Dumbledore swam into view above him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Good afternoon, Harry," said Dumbledore. Harry stared at him. Then he remembered: "Sir! The Stone! It was Quirrell! He's got the Stone! Sir, quick --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Calm yourself, dear boy, you are a little behind the times," said Dumbledore. "Quirrell does not have the Stone."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Then who does? Sir, I --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Harry, please relax, or Madam Pomfrey will have me thrown out.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry swallowed and looked around him. He realized he must be in the hospital wing. He was lying in a bed with white linen sheets, and next

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: to him was a table piled high with what looked like half the candy shop.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Tokens from your friends and admirers," said Dumbledore, beaming. "What happened down in the dungeons between you and Professor Quirrell is a complete secret, so, naturally, the whole school knows. I believe your friends Misters Fred and George Weasley were responsible for trying to send you a toilet seat. No doubt they thought it would amuse you. Madam Pomfrey, however, felt it might not be very hygienic, and confiscated it."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "How long have I been in here?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Three days. Mr. Ronald Weasley and Miss Granger will be most relieved you have come round, they have been extremely worried."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But sit, the Stone

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: I see you are not to be distracted. Very well, the Stone. Professor Quirrell did not manage to take it from you. I arrived in time to prevent that, although you were doing very well on your own, I must say.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You got there? You got Hermione's owl?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "We must have crossed in midair. No sooner had I reached London than it became clear to me that the place I should be was the one I had just left. I arrived just in time to pull Quirrell off you."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It was you."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I feared I might be too late."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You nearly were, I couldn't have kept him off the Stone much longer --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Not the Stone, boy, you -- the effort involved nearly killed you. For one terrible moment there, I was afraid it had. As for the Stone, it has been destroyed."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Destroyed?" said Harry blankly. "But your friend -- Nicolas Flamel --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Oh, you know about Nicolas?" said Dumbledore, sounding quite delighted. "You did do the thing properly, didn't you? Well, Nicolas and I have had a little chat, and agreed it's all for the best."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But that means he and his wife will die, won't they?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "They have enough Elixir stored to set their affairs in order and then, yes, they will die."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Dumbledore smiled at the look of amazement on Harry's face.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "To one as young as you, I'm sure it seems incredible, but to Nicolas and Perenelle, it really is like going to bed after a very, very long day. After all, to the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure. You know, the Stone was really not such a wonderful thing. As much money and life as you could want! The two things most human beings would choose above all -- the trouble is, humans do have a knack of choosing precisely those things that are worst for them." Harry lay there, lost for words. Dumbledore hummed a little and smiled at the ceiling.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Sir?" said Harry. "I've been thinking... sir -- even if the Stone's gone, Vol-, I mean, You-Know- Who --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Call him Voldemort, Harry. Always use the proper name for things. Fear of a name increases fear of the thing itself."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yes, sir. Well, Voldemort's going to try other ways of coming back, isn't he? I mean, he hasn't gone, has he?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "No, Harry, he has not. He is still out there somewhere, perhaps looking for another body to share... not being truly alive, he cannot be killed. He left Quirrell to die; he shows just as little mercy to his followers as his enemies. Nevertheless, Harry, while you may only have delayed his return to power, it will merely take someone else who is prepared to fight what seems a losing battle next time -- and if he is delayed again, and again, why, he may never return to power."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry nodded, but stopped quickly, because it made his head hurt. Then he said, "Sir, there are some other things I'd like to know, if you can tell me... things I want to know the truth about...."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "The truth." Dumbledore sighed. "It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution. However, I shall answer your questions unless I have a very good reason not to, in which case I beg you'll forgive me. I shall not, of course, lie."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well... Voldemort said that he only killed my mother because she tried to stop him from killing me. But why would he want to kill me in the first place?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Dumbledore sighed very deeply this time.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Alas, the first thing you ask me, I cannot tell you. Not today. Not now. You will know, one day... put it from your mind for now, Harry. When you are older... I know you hate to hear this... when you are ready, you will know."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: And Harry knew it would be no good to argue.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "But why couldn't Quirrell touch me?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Your mother died to save you. If there is one thing Voldemort cannot understand, it is love. He didn't realize that love as powerful as your mother's for you leaves its own mark. Not a scar, no visible sign... to have been loved so deeply, even though the person who loved us is gone, will give us some protection forever. It is in your very skin. Quirrell, full of hatred, greed, and ambition, sharing his soul with Voldemort, could not touch you for this reason. It was agony to touch a person marked by something so good."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Dumbledore now became very interested in a bird out on the windowsill, which gave Harry time to dry his eyes on the sheet. When he had found his voice again, Harry said, "And the invisibility cloak - do you know who sent it to me?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Ah - your father happened to leave it in my possession, and I thought you might like it." Dumbledore's eyes twinkled. "Useful things... your father used it mainly for sneaking off to the kitchens to steal food when he was here."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "And there's something else..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Fire away."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Quirrell said Snape --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Professor Snape, Harry." "Yes, him -- Quirrell said he hates me because he hated my father. Is that true?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well, they did rather detest each other. Not unlike yourself and Mr. Malfoy. And then, your father did something Snape could never forgive."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "What?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "He saved his life."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
