text: "What?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yes..." said Dumbledore dreamily. "Funny, the way people's minds work, isn't it? Professor Snape couldn't bear being in your father's debt.... I do believe he worked so hard to protect you this year because he felt that would make him and your father even. Then he could go back to hating your father's memory in peace...."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry tried to understand this but it made his head pound, so he stopped.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "And sir, there's one more thing..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Just the one?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "How did I get the Stone out of the mirror?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Ah, now, I'm glad you asked me that. It was one of my more brilliant ideas, and between you and me, that's saying something. You see, only one who wanted to find the Stone -- find it, but not use it -- would be able to get it, otherwise they'd just see themselves making gold or drinking Elixir of Life. My brain surprises even me sometimes.... Now, enough questions. I suggest you make a start on these sweets. Ah! Bettie Bott's Every Flavor Beans! I was unfortunate enough in my youth to come across a vomitflavored one, and since then I'm afraid I've rather lost my liking for them -- but I think I'll be safe with a nice toffee, don't you?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He smiled and popped the golden-brown bean into his mouth. Then he choked and said, "Alas! Ear wax!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Madam Pomfrey, the nurse, was a nice woman, but very strict.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Just five minutes," Harry pleaded.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Absolutely not."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You let Professor Dumbledore in..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well, of course, that was the headmaster, quite different. You need rest."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I am resting, look, lying down and everything. Oh, go on, Madam Pomfrey..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Oh, very well," she said. "But five minutes only."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: And she let Ron and Hermione in.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Harry!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione looked ready to fling her arms around him again, but Harry was glad she held herself in as his head was still very sore.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Oh, Harry, we were sure you were going to -- Dumbledore was so worried --"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "The whole school's talking about it," said Ron. "What really happened?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It was one of those rare occasions when the true story is even more strange and exciting than the wild rumors. Harry told them everything: Quirrell; the mirror; the Stone; and Voldemort. Ron and Hermione were a very good audience; they gasped in all the right places, and when Harry told them what was under Quirrell's turban, Hermione screamed out loud.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "So the Stone's gone?" said Ron finally. "Flamel's just going to die?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "That's what I said, but Dumbledore thinks that -- what was it? -- 'to the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "I always said he was off his rocker," said Ron, looking quite impressed at how crazy his hero was.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "So what happened to you two?" said Harry.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well, I got back all right," said Hermione. "I brought Ron round -- that took a while -- and we were dashing up to the owlery to contact Dumbledore when we met him in the entrance hall -- he already knew -- he just said, 'Harry's gone after him, hasn't he?' and hurtled off to the

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: third floor."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "D'you think he meant you to do it?" said Ron. "Sending you your father's cloak and everything?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Well, " Hermione exploded, "if he did -- I mean to say that's terrible -- you could have been killed."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "No, it isn't," said Harry thoughtfully. "He's a funny man, Dumbledore. I think he sort of wanted to give me a chance. I think he knows more or less everything that goes on here, you know. I reckon he had a pretty good idea we were going to try, and instead of stopping us, he just taught us enough to help. I don't think it was an accident he let me find out how the mirror worked. It's almost like he thought I had the right to face Voldemort if I could...."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yeah, Dumbledore's off his rocker, all right," said Ron proudly. "Listen, you've got to be up for the end-of-year feast tomorrow. The points are all in and Slytherin won, of course -- you missed the last Quidditch match, we were steamrollered by Ravenclaw without you -- but the food'll be good."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: At that moment, Madam Pomfrey bustled over.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You've had nearly fifteen minutes, now OUT" she said firmly.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: After a good night's sleep, Harry felt nearly back to normal.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: I want to go to the feast," he told Madam Pomfrey as she straightened his many candy boxes. I can, can't I?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Professor Dumbledore says you are to be allowed to go," she said stiffily, as though in her opinion Professor Dumbledore didn't realize how risky feasts could be. "And you have another visitor."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Oh, good," said Harry. "Who is it?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hagrid sidled through the door as he spoke. As usual when he was indoors, Hagrid looked too big to be allowed. He sat down next to Harry, took one look at him, and burst into tears.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It's -- all -- my -- ruddy -- fault!" he sobbed, his face in his hands. I told the evil git how ter get past Fluffy! I told him! It was the only

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: thing he didn't know, an' I told him! Yeh could've died! All fer a dragon egg! I'll never drink again! I should be chucked out an' made ter live as a Muggle!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Hagrid!" said Harry, shocked to see Hagrid shaking with grief and remorse, great tears leaking down into his beard. "Hagrid, he'd have found out somehow, this is Voldemort we're talking about, he'd have found out even if you hadn't told him."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yeh could've died!" sobbed Hagrid. "An' don' say the name!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "VOLDEMORT!" Harry bellowed, and Hagrid was so shocked, he stopped crying. "I've met him and I'm calling him by his name. Please cheer up, Hagrid, we saved the Stone, it's gone, he can't use it. Have a Chocolate Frog, I've got loads...."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hagrid wiped his nose on the back of his hand and said, "That reminds me. I've got yeh a present."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "It's not a stoat sandwich, is it?" said Harry anxiously, and at last Hagrid gave a weak chuckle. "Nah. Dumbledore gave me the day off yesterday ter fix it. 'Course, he shoulda sacked me instead -- anyway, got yeh this..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It seemed to be a handsome, leather-covered book. Harry opened it curiously. It was full of wizard photographs. Smiling and waving at him from every page were his mother and father.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Sent owls off ter all yer parents' old school friends, askin' fer photos... knew yeh didn' have any... d'yeh like it?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry couldn't speak, but Hagrid understood.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry made his way down to the end-of-year feast alone that night. He had been held up by Madam Pomfrey's fussing about, insisting on giving him one last checkup, so the Great Hall was already full. It was decked out in the Slytherin colors of green and silver to celebrate Slytherin's winning the house cup for the seventh year in a row. A huge banner showing the Slytherin serpent covered the wall behind the High Table.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: When Harry walked in there was a sudden hush, and then everybody started talking loudly at once. He slipped into a seat between Ron and Hermione at the Gryffindor table and tried to ignore the fact that people were

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: standing up to look at him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Fortunately, Dumbledore arrived moments later. The babble died away.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Another year gone!" Dumbledore said cheerfully. "And I must trouble you with an old man's wheezing waffle before we sink our teeth into our delicious feast. What a year it has been! Hopefully your heads are all a little fuller than they were... you have the whole summer ahead to get them nice and empty before next year starts....

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Now, as I understand it, the house cup here needs awarding, and the points stand thus: In fourth place, Gryffindor, with three hundred and twelve points; in third, Hufflepuff, with three hundred and fifty-two; Ravenclaw has four hundred and twenty-six and Slytherin, four hundred and seventy- two."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: A storm of cheering and stamping broke out from the Slytherin table. Harry could see Draco Malfoy banging his goblet on the table. It was a sickening sight.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Yes, Yes, well done, Slytherin," said Dumbledore. "However, recent events must be taken into account."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The room went very still. The Slytherins' smiles faded a little.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Ahem," said Dumbledore. "I have a few last-minute points to dish out. Let me see. Yes...

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "First -- to Mr. Ronald Weasley..."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Ron went purple in the face; he looked like a radish with a bad sunburn.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "...for the best-played game of chess Hogwarts has seen in many years, I award Gryffindor house fifty points."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Gryffindor cheers nearly raised the bewitched ceiling; the stars overhead seemed to quiver. Percy could be heard telling the other prefects, "My brother, you know! My youngest brother! Got past McGonagall's giant chess set!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: At last there was silence again.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Second -- to Miss Hermione Granger... for the use of cool logic in the

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: face of fire, I award Gryffindor house fifty points."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Hermione buried her face in her arms; Harry strongly suspected she had burst into tears. Gryffindors up and down the table were beside themselves -- they were a hundred points up. "Third -- to Mr. Harry Potter..." said Dumbledore. The room went deadly quiet for pure nerve and outstanding courage, I award Gryffindor house sixty points."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: The din was deafening. Those who could add up while yelling themselves hoarse knew that Gryffindor now had four hundred and seventy-two points -- exactly the same as Slytherin. They had tied for the house cup -- if only Dumbledore had given Harry just one more point.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Dumbledore raised his hand. The room gradually fell silent.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "There are all kinds of courage," said Dumbledore, smiling. "It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends. I therefore award ten points to Mr. Neville Longbottom."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Someone standing outside the Great Hall might well have thought some sort of explosion had taken place, so loud was the noise that erupted from the Gryffindor table. Harry, Ron, and Hermione stood up to yell and cheer as Neville, white with shock, disappeared under a pile of people hugging him. He had never won so much as a point for Gryffindor before. Harry, still cheering, nudged Ron in the ribs and pointed at Malfoy, who couldn't have looked more stunned and horrified if he'd just had the Body-Bind Curse put on him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Which means, Dumbledore called over the storm of applause, for even Ravenclaw and Hufflepuff were celebrating the downfall of Slytherin, "we need a little change of decoration."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He clapped his hands. In an instant, the green hangings became scarlet and the silver became gold; the huge Slytherin serpent vanished and a towering Gryffindor lion took its place. Snape was shaking Professor McGonagall's hand, with a horrible, forced smile. He caught Harry's eye and Harry knew at once that Snape's feelings toward him hadn't changed one jot. This didn't worry Harry. It seemed as though life would be back to normal next year, or as normal as it ever was at Hogwarts.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It was the best evening of Harry's life, better than winning at Quidditch, or Christmas, or knocking out mountain trolls... he would

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: never, ever forget tonight.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry had almost forgotten that the exam results were still to come, but come they did. To their great surprise, both he and Ron passed with good marks; Hermione, of course, had the best grades of the first years. Even Neville scraped through, his good Herbology mark making up for his abysmal Potions one. They had hoped that Goyle, who was almost as stupid as he was mean, might be thrown out, but he had passed, too. It was a shame, but as Ron said, you couldn't have everything in life.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: And suddenly, their wardrobes were empty, their trunks were packed, Neville's toad was found lurking in a corner of the toilets; notes were handed out to all students, warning them not to use magic over the holidays ("I always hope they'll forget to give us these," said Fred Weasley sadly); Hagrid was there to take them down to the fleet of boats that sailed across the lake; they were boarding the Hogwarts Express; talking and laughing as the countryside became greener and tidier; eating Bettie Bott's Every Flavor Beans as they sped past Muggle towns; pulling off their wizard robes and putting on jackets and coats; pulling into platform nine and three-quarters at King's Cross Station.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It took quite a while for them all to get off the platform. A wizened old guard was up by the ticket barrier, letting them go through the gate in twos and threes so they didn't attract attention by all bursting out of a solid wall at once and alarming the Muggles.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You must come and stay this summer," said Ron, "both of you -- I'll send you an owl."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Thanks," said Harry, "I'll need something to look forward to." People jostled them as they moved forward toward the gateway back to the Muggle world. Some of them called:

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Bye, Harry!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "See you, Potter!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Still famous," said Ron, grinning at him.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Not where I'm going, I promise you," said Harry.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: He, Ron, and Hermione passed through the gateway together. "There he is, Mom, there he is, look!"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf
Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It was Ginny Weasley, Ron's younger sister, but she wasn't pointing at Ron.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Harry Potter!" she squealed. "Look, Mom! I can see

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Be quiet, Ginny, and it's rude to point."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Mrs. Weasley smiled down at them.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Busy year?" she said.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Very," said Harry. "Thanks for the fudge and the sweater, Mrs. Weasley."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Oh, it was nothing, dear."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Ready, are you?"

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: It was Uncle Vernon, still purple-faced, still mustached, still looking furious at the nerve of Harry, carrying an owl in a cage in a station full of ordinary people. Behind him stood Aunt Petunia and Dudley, looking terrified at the very sight of Harry.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "You must be Harry's family!" said Mrs. Weasley.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "In a manner of speaking," said Uncle Vernon. "Hurry up, boy, we haven't got all day." He walked away.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: Harry hung back for a last word with Ron and Hermione.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "See you over the summer, then."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Hope you have -- er -- a good holiday," said Hermione, looking uncertainly after Uncle Vernon, shocked that anyone could be so unpleasant.

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: "Oh, I will," said Harry, and they were surprised at the grin that was spreading over his face. "They don't know we're not allowed to use magic at home. I'm going to have a lot of fun with Dudley this summer...."

metadata.filename: Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.pdf

text: THE END
